text:
I legitimately teared up the first time I got on Ramia while playing the Switch version for the first time.

The game really does a lot with a little. This song + being able to soar over a world you've had to stumble your way across and explore by that point + the orbs representing all the little adventures you've had to have along the way really got me.

text: @carlos stockman - you say that like Final Fantasy doesn't also have fantastic music. I don't think Niar was trying to take anything away from the song by making the FF comparison. If anything Koichi Sugiyama and Nobuo Uematsu probably came from a lot of the same sources of inspiration.

text: @Graham Entwistle I think he was eluding to the undisputable fact that FF owes it's very existence to the Dragon Quest series.
